By Alex Thompson

Editor's Letter

This is your fast track pass to London Fashion week February 2010

Take a walk on the wild side

By James Bithell

May Delaney styled by Sofia Redgrave and Tess Webb

Ones to watch

By James Bithell

Model: Lindsey Wixson Trend: The New Animal Designer: The Takeover New Era: Film to Fashion

Sofia Redgrave

'Take a walk on the wild side' is the name we aptly gave to our shoot this month - clothes are clashing, patterned and inspired by wildlife and the jungle

Sustain Me! York

Sustainable fashion can often feel like a contradiction in terms. Trends come, trends go, before you know it you've a wardrobe fit to burst and trying to put together an outfit in the morning is like a heavyweight military operation

The man behind the Chanel

In a flurry of the emotional days before my A2 summer exams, my friend Zach and I decided to book a tightly budgeted trip to Paris, fashion capital of Europe

Sofia Redgrave

It's January, and I'm sure that the extra pounds accumulated over Christmas are playing on all our minds

Q&A: Katherine Alexander

Katherine Alexander is the talk of the town with her eye-catching hand made cuffs

Tessa Webb looks at the new glamorous eye

By James Bithell

Seen on the S/S10 catwalks at Vuitton and Prada, make-up artists are proving glitter shouldn't be shied away from. Tess Webb looks at the new glamorous eye, with a step-by-step guide. Keep it bold, strong and give glitter a chance

By James Bithell

Sequins and embellishments return in full gusto, constellations and panels provide a new take on all over glitz

Sofia Redgrave

This year, I have decided to cycle to campus every day.

Ones to Watch

By James Bithell

Tavi, the thirteen year-old self-confessed dork is fast becoming one of the major players in the international fashion over and above the millions of other online bloggers.

Soren Bach

Millinery is essential to the atmosphere of an outfit. <strong>Liam O'Brien</strong> interviews Soren Bach, maker of headwear-extraordinaire.

Sofia Redgrave

As this is a special freshers' edition, I thought I should save my comments on this season's London Fashion Week, (size 12 models on the catwalk, Anna Wintour, and Burberry!) and hopefully tell you something useful about shopping in York

<strong>Hannah Smith</strong> and <strong>Laura Connor</strong> talk to the charitable jewellery designer

Vintage fashion fairs

Vintage, fashion and fair. Three words to get any self respecting style enthusiast excited indeed.

Michael Jackson: Fashion Retrospective

Michael Jackson was undoubtedly a singing legend, but his diverse fashionable look also influenced designers, trends, fans, fashion editors and stylists alike.

Graduate Fashion Week

By James Bithell

<strong>Sofia Redgrave </strong>attended Graduate Fashion Week at Earls Court, a forum to showcase the very best design talent from across the country. This year's judges included Matthew Williamson, Giles Deacon and Lorraine Candy, editor of Elle. Sofia interviews the best talent on offer, and talks to past winners.

Roksanda llincic

Roksanda sat opposite me on the front row at the Edinburgh College of Art fashion show at Graduate Fashion Week (GFW), there to support Joseph McGee, who has assisted her since her Spring/Summer 08 collection
